name: Classical Antiquity
descr: Literary works from ancient Greece and Rome (8th century BCE - 5th century CE)

name: Medieval Literature
descr: Literary works from the Middle Ages (5th - 15th century)

name: Baroque
descr: Ornate and dramatic literary style (17th century)

name: Neoclassicism
descr: Return to classical ideals and order (17th - 18th century)

name: Enlightenment
descr: Age of reason and intellectual revolution (18th century)

name: Romanticism
descr: Emotion over reason and individualism (late 18th - mid 19th century)

name: Realism
descr: Accurate representation of everyday life (mid-19th century)

name: Symbolism
descr: Use of symbols to express ideas and emotions (late 19th century)

name: Modernism
descr: Experimental forms and rejection of tradition (early 20th century)

name: Postmodernism
descr: Questioning of grand narratives and reality (mid-late 20th century)

name: Victorian Era
descr: British literature during Queen Victoria's reign (1837-1901)

name: Magic Realism
descr: Fantastical elements in realistic settings (20th century)
